org.jgentleframework.services.objectpooling.context
Interface CanBePooled

All Known Subinterfaces:
Poolable
public interface CanBePooled

This interface gives you a good opportunity to check the state of your component. If you determine that your object is no longer in a consistent state, you can return false from canBePooled() method, and the object is not returned to the pool.

Author:
Quoc Chung - mailto: skydunkpro@yahoo.com
See Also:
Deactivate, Validate, CanBePooledMethod

Method Summary
 boolean canBePooled()
          Check the state of the component bean.
 

Method Detail

canBePooled

boolean canBePooled()
Check the state of the component bean. If returned value is false, the component is not returned to the pool.

If this method is not implemented, pooling service assumes that it returns true.
